bibl.title: A Mummy Portrait of Antinous from Thebes.
Portraits and Masks. Burial Customs in Roman Egypt
bibl.author: GRAEFE, E.

bibl.note: Fragment of a portrait found in the uppermost layer of debris in the open court (Lichthof) of Theban Tomb 196, Object No. P72 052. Greek inscription giving the name, the profession (na√äklhrow) and the lifetime of the person. Possibly before AD 212. <naukleros>
bibl.seg: GRAEFE E., A Mummy Portrait of Antinous from Thebes.
Morris L. BIERBRIER (Ed.), Portraits and Masks. Burial Customs in Roman Egypt (London, 1997) p. 54 et pl. 5, 2.
